cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move northwest, cross the northern Yucatán late Monday, then turn north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the southeast Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast, near Plaquemines Parish

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch/Warning limited to Yucatán Peninsula (Tulum to Río Lagartos) – none yet for U.S. Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Tulum-Río Lagartos (Yucatán), Tropical-Storm Warning for Pinar del Río Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to Alabama–Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) possible by early Wednesday with a low (but increasing) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests a 2–4 ft or higher surge possible along the Plaquemines coastline, especially east-facing shores and lower Mississippi River.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches possible with locally higher totals, leading to flash-flood risk in low-lying port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands and short-fuse river rises along the lower Mississippi may disrupt port operations.
